content.question: The design of Structure 33 on the central acropolis of Yaxchilán was likely intended to increase the impact of the building by

choices.label: incorporating precious building materials that were taken as tribute from distant lands
erecting its walls on top of an older pyramid that had been built by a vanquished civilization
creating the impression of greater height through the addition of an elaborate roof comb
enabling the construction of a perfectly smooth wall through precisely fit masonry blocks

content.answer: creating the impression of greater height through the addition of an elaborate roof comb

topic.text: 5.3: Purpose and Audience in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
